metadata.title: CVE-2017-16909 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An error related to the "LibRaw::panasonic_load_raw()" function(dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.6 can be exploited tocause a heap-based buffer overflow and subsequently cause a crash via aspecially crafted TIFF image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16909` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.8-1
libraw16 - 0.18.8-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.8-1').
ufraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
exactimage: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
dcraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
rawtherapee: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
